line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.
* For the full copyright and license information, please view the LICENSE
* file that was distributed with this source code.
* The ProgressBar provides helpers to display progress output.
// disable overwrite when output does not support ANSI codes.
// set a reasonable redraw frequency so output isn't flooded
* Sets a placeholder formatter for a given name.
* This method also allow you to override an existing placeholder.
* @param string $name The placeholder name (including the delimiter char like %)
* Gets the placeholder formatter for a given name.
* @param string $name The placeholder name (including the delimiter char like %)
* Sets a format for a given name.
* This method also allow you to override an existing format.
* Gets the format for a given name.
* Gets the progress bar start time.
* @return int The progress bar start time
* Gets the progress bar maximal steps.
* @return int The progress bar max steps
* @deprecated since version 2.6, to be removed in 3.0. Use {@link getProgress()} instead.
' method is deprecated since version 2.6 and will be removed in 3.0. Use the getProgress() method instead.'
* Gets the progress bar step width.
* @internal This method is public for PHP 5.3 compatibility, it should not be used.
* @return int The progress bar step width
* Gets the current progress bar percent.
* @return float The current progress bar percent
* @param int|null $max Number of steps to complete the bar (0 if indeterminate), null to leave unchanged
* Advances the progress output X steps.
* @param int $step Number of steps to advance
* @deprecated since version 2.6, to be removed in 3.0. Use {@link setProgress()} instead.
' method is deprecated since version 2.6 and will be removed in 3.0. Use the setProgress() method instead.'
* Sets whether to overwrite the progressbar, false for new line.
// these 3 variables can be removed in favor of using $this in the closure when support for PHP 5.3 will be dropped.
* Removes the progress bar from the current line.
* This is useful if you wish to write some output
* while a progress bar is running.
* Call display() to show the progress bar again.
// try to use the _nomax variant if available
* Sets the progress bar maximal steps.
* @param int $max The progress bar max steps
* Overwrites a previous message to the output.
// append whitespace to match the line's length
// move back to the beginning of the progress bar before redrawing it
'Unable to display the remaining time if the maximum number of steps is not set.'
'Unable to display the estimated time if the maximum number of steps is not set.'
